contradiction_map.statement_a: TF‚ÄëIDF BM25 and TF‚ÄëIDF are both bag-of-words retrieval methods,
contradiction_map.statement_b: BM25 introduced important improvements over classic TF‚ÄëIDF: Feature\tBM25\tTF‚ÄëIDF Term Frequency Scaling\tSaturation effect (controlled by k‚ÇÅ)\tLinear scaling (no saturation) Document Length Handling\tNormalized (parameter b) to avoid bias\tUnadjusted (long docs favored) Robustness\tHigh across diverse datasets (tunable)\tOften sensitive to corpus changes Interpretability\tTransparent, explainable scoring\tSimple formula (less refined control) Semantic Awareness\tNone (lexical only, no synonym support)\tNone (lexical only) Table: Key differences between BM25 and TF‚ÄëIDF

contradiction_map.statement_a: As a result, BM25 tends to produce fairer and more relevant rankings,
contradiction_map.statement_b: vanilla TF‚ÄëIDF might overvalue longer documents or repetitive terms

contradiction_map.statement_b: BM25‚Äôs tuning capability and probabilistic underpinnings usually give it an edge in retrieval effectiveness medium
